title: Luke Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Luke chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Luke Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Luke Chapter 10.

questions.question: How many disciples did the Lord appoint and send out as described in Luke 10?
options: Seventy
Twelve
One hundred
Fifty
questions.correctAnswer: Seventy
questions.explanation: Luke 10:1 states that the Lord appointed seventy others and sent them two and two.

questions.question: According to Luke 10:2, what did Jesus say about the harvest?
options: The harvest truly is great, but the laborers are few
The harvest is small, but the workers are many
The harvest is delayed, and the workers are tired
The harvest is ready, and the workers are ready
questions.correctAnswer: The harvest truly is great, but the laborers are few
questions.explanation: Jesus said the harvest is great but the laborers are few, urging prayer for more laborers (Luke 10:2).

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the seventy to carry with them on their journey?
options: Neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes
Only a purse and shoes
A sword and sandals
Food and water
questions.correctAnswer: Neither purse, nor scrip, nor shoes
questions.explanation: Luke 10:4 instructs them to carry neither purse, scrip, nor shoes.

questions.question: What greeting did Jesus instruct the seventy to give when they entered a house?
options: Peace be to this house
Greetings in the name of the Lord
Blessings on this home
May God bless you
questions.correctAnswer: Peace be to this house
questions.explanation: In Luke 10:5, Jesus told them to say, 'Peace be to this house' upon entering.

questions.question: What were the seventy told to do if the people in a city did not receive them?
options: Shake the dust off their feet and leave
Pray for the city
Stay and preach longer
Return immediately to Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Shake the dust off their feet and leave
questions.explanation: Luke 10:10-11 explains they should shake off the dust of that city and leave if not received.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say would have a more tolerable judgment than the cities that rejected the seventy?
options: Sodom
Jerusalem
Nazareth
Bethlehem
questions.correctAnswer: Sodom
questions.explanation: Luke 10:12 states that it will be more tolerable for Sodom than for those cities.

questions.question: Which city did Jesus say would be 'thrust down to hell'?
options: Capernaum
Jericho
Bethsaida
Chorazin
questions.correctAnswer: Capernaum
questions.explanation: In Luke 10:15, Jesus declares that Capernaum, though exalted, shall be brought down.

questions.question: What did Jesus say about one who hears the seventy disciples?
options: He who hears you hears me
He who hears you hears only you
He who hears you must pay a tax
He who hears you hears the law
questions.correctAnswer: He who hears you hears me
questions.explanation: Luke 10:16 states that he who hears the disciples hears Jesus himself.

questions.question: What did the seventy disciples report joyfully upon their return?
options: Even the devils are subject unto us through thy name
We have healed all the sick
We have preached in every city
We have found treasures
questions.correctAnswer: Even the devils are subject unto us through thy name
questions.explanation: Luke 10:17 records the seventy rejoicing that even devils were subject to them.

questions.question: According to Jesus in Luke 10:19, what power is given to the seventy?
options: Power to tread on serpents and scorpions
Power to multiply food
Power to walk on water
Power to raise the dead
questions.correctAnswer: Power to tread on serpents and scorpions
questions.explanation: Luke 10:19 describes the power to tread on serpents and scorpions and over all the enemy’s power.

questions.question: Who did Jesus say has revealed the things of the kingdom to babes?
options: The Father
The angels
The scribes
The Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: The Father
questions.explanation: Luke 10:21 shows Jesus thanking the Father for revealing these things to babes.

questions.question: What question did the lawyer ask Jesus in Luke 10?
options: Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
Master, where is the kingdom of God?
Master, how do we pray?
Master, who is the greatest?
questions.correctAnswer: Master, what shall I do to inherit eternal life?
questions.explanation: Luke 10:25 records the lawyer asking how to inherit eternal life.

questions.question: In the parable of the Good Samaritan, who passed by the injured man without helping?
options: A priest and a Levite
A farmer and a merchant
A Pharisee and a scribe
A soldier and a tax collector
questions.correctAnswer: A priest and a Levite
questions.explanation: Luke 10:31-32 shows both a priest and a Levite passing by on the other side.

questions.question: Who showed mercy to the man who fell among thieves?
options: The Samaritan
The priest
The Levite
The lawyer
questions.correctAnswer: The Samaritan
questions.explanation: Luke 10:33-34 tells how a Samaritan had compassion and helped the injured man.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told Martha that Mary had chosen the better part by sitting at His feet and listening.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 10:42 states Mary chose the good part which would not be taken away.

medium.title: Luke Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Luke Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Luke 10 teach us about trusting God in the face of difficulty when Jesus sends the seventy out?
options: Go as lambs among wolves without carrying provisions
Take plenty of food and money for safety
Avoid entering any city and stay hidden
Only preach to friends and family
questions.correctAnswer: Go as lambs among wolves without carrying provisions
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs sending the seventy out 'as lambs among wolves' and not to carry purse, scrip, or shoes, showing dependence on God’s provision and protection (Luke 10:3-4). This teaches trust in God over self-sufficiency (Luke 10:1-4).

questions.question: What biblical truth about prayer and labor does Jesus emphasize when sending out the seventy?
options: Pray the Lord of the harvest to send laborers
Pray only after the harvest is complete
Work alone without prayer
Pray for personal wealth first
questions.correctAnswer: Pray the Lord of the harvest to send laborers
questions.explanation: Jesus says the harvest is great but laborers few, so they must pray to God to send forth laborers, highlighting the importance of prayer in spiritual work (Luke 10:2). This encourages dependence on God’s timing and empowerment (Luke 10:1-2).

questions.question: How does Jesus instruct the seventy to respond when received in a city?
options: Eat what is given and heal the sick
Take only bread and avoid drinking
Move from house to house seeking the best food
Preach but do not stay in the city
questions.correctAnswer: Eat what is given and heal the sick
questions.explanation: Jesus commands that when welcomed, they should eat what is provided, heal the sick, and declare that the kingdom of God is near (Luke 10:8-9). This shows humility and service in evangelism (Luke 10:7-9).

questions.question: What should the seventy do if a city does not receive them?
options: Shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony
Stay and argue with the people
Ignore the city and preach elsewhere
Take possessions from the city as judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs that if a city rejects them, they should leave and shake off the dust from that city as a testimony against them, signifying judgment (Luke 10:10-11). This teaches humility and respect even in rejection (Luke 10:10-12).

questions.question: How does Luke 10 teach us about the importance of spiritual authority and humility?
options: Rejoice that your names are written in heaven, not just in spiritual power
Boast about having power over spirits
Avoid spiritual battle completely
Seek earthly fame for your works
questions.correctAnswer: Rejoice that your names are written in heaven, not just in spiritual power
questions.explanation: Jesus tells the seventy not to rejoice in spirits being subject to them, but rather because their names are written in heaven (Luke 10:20). This teaches humility and eternal perspective in spiritual work (Luke 10:17-20).

questions.question: What does the parable of the Good Samaritan teach us about love for our neighbor?
options: Showing mercy to those in need regardless of differences
Helping only those from your own community
Avoiding involvement in others' troubles
Judging others before helping
questions.correctAnswer: Showing mercy to those in need regardless of differences
questions.explanation: Jesus tells how the Samaritan helped the injured man, showing compassion and mercy beyond social boundaries (Luke 10:30-37). This teaches loving our neighbor as ourselves, regardless of background (Luke 10:25-37).

questions.question: Based on Luke 10, how should believers respond when feeling overwhelmed with service and duties?
options: Focus on the one thing needed: listening to Jesus' word
Complain and demand others help
Ignore spiritual nourishment
Abandon serving altogether
questions.correctAnswer: Focus on the one thing needed: listening to Jesus' word
questions.explanation: When Martha was troubled by serving, Jesus told her that Mary chose the good part by sitting at His feet and listening, teaching the priority of spiritual devotion over anxious service (Luke 10:38-42).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about those who hear and accept his chosen messengers?
options: He who hears you hears me; he who rejects you rejects me
Only the messenger is important, not the message
Ignore those who reject the message
Accept everyone equally without distinction
questions.correctAnswer: He who hears you hears me; he who rejects you rejects me
questions.explanation: Jesus states that hearing or despising his disciples is the same as hearing or despising Him and the one who sent Him, emphasizing the authority given to His messengers (Luke 10:16).

questions.question: How does Luke 10 encourage believers to view evangelism and healing ministry?
options: As integral signs that the kingdom of God is near
As optional extras to preaching
As acts to gain personal fame
As unrelated to the Gospel message
questions.correctAnswer: As integral signs that the kingdom of God is near
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs to heal the sick and proclaim the kingdom is near, showing healing as a sign of God's kingdom presence and gospel truth (Luke 10:9).

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 10, Jesus gives power to overcome all the power of the enemy and assures no harm will come to the seventy sent out.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus gives them power over serpents, scorpions, and all the power of the enemy and promises nothing will hurt them (Luke 10:19). This assures believers of God’s protection in spiritual work.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus praises Martha for focusing more on serving than on listening to His teaching.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Jesus gently rebukes Martha for being troubled with many things and affirms Mary’s choice to listen to His word as the better part (Luke 10:41-42). This teaches prioritizing spiritual nourishment over anxious service.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with self-justification. Based on the lawyer's question and Jesus' response in Luke 10, what biblical principle would you share?
options: Love God fully and love your neighbor as yourself
Perform rituals to earn eternal life
Argue to prove your righteousness
Avoid questioning the law
questions.correctAnswer: Love God fully and love your neighbor as yourself
questions.explanation: Jesus directs the lawyer to answer that loving God with all heart, soul, strength, and mind and loving neighbor as self fulfills the law and leads to life (Luke 10:25-28). This teaches humility and true righteousness.

questions.question: How does this passage teach us about generosity and stewardship in caring for others in need?
options: The Samaritan paid for care and promised to repay extra costs
Only give when others can see your generosity
Ignore needs outside your immediate circle
Give reluctantly and with complaint
questions.correctAnswer: The Samaritan paid for care and promised to repay extra costs
questions.explanation: The Samaritan not only cared for the wounded man but also gave money to the innkeeper and promised to pay any additional costs, showing sacrificial generosity and responsible stewardship (Luke 10:34-35).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy ______, and with all thy soul, and with all thy strength, and with all thy mind.'
options: heart
wealth
mind
actions
questions.correctAnswer: heart
questions.explanation: The lawyer quotes the commandment to love God with all heart, soul, strength, and mind, emphasizing total devotion (Luke 10:27).

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the privilege of his disciples in Luke 10?
options: Blessed are the eyes which see what you see
Blessed are those who remain ignorant
Blessed are those who avoid trials
Blessed are those who seek earthly riches
questions.correctAnswer: Blessed are the eyes which see what you see
questions.explanation: Jesus says the disciples are blessed to see and hear things that many prophets and kings desired but never experienced, highlighting the privilege of faith and revelation (Luke 10:23-24).

hard.title: Luke Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Luke Chapter 10.

questions.question: In Luke 10:1-2, Jesus sends out seventy others in pairs. What is the metaphorical significance of the 'harvest' and 'labourers' in this context?
options: The harvest represents the gathering of souls, and labourers are the messengers of God
The harvest symbolizes agricultural work, and labourers are farmers
The harvest means the end of the world, and labourers are angels
The harvest is a military conquest, and labourers are soldiers
questions.correctAnswer: The harvest represents the gathering of souls, and labourers are the messengers of God
questions.explanation: Luke 10:2 uses the metaphor of a harvest to indicate the great number of people ready to receive the gospel, and labourers refer to the disciples sent to minister and preach.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus instructing the seventy to carry neither purse, scrip, nor shoes in Luke 10:4, and how does this relate to Old Testament practices?
options: It signifies reliance on God's provision, paralleling the mission of the seventy elders in Numbers
It was a cultural practice to show humility only in Judea
It was to avoid theft in dangerous cities
It symbolized readiness for war as in the conquest of Canaan
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies reliance on God's provision, paralleling the mission of the seventy elders in Numbers
questions.explanation: The instruction to carry no provisions echoes the Old Testament reliance on God’s provision, as in Numbers 11:16-25 where seventy elders were appointed to share God's Spirit.

questions.question: In Luke 10:9, the seventy were told to heal the sick and proclaim what message?
options: The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you
Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand
The Messiah has arrived
Salvation is through the law
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of God is come nigh unto you
questions.explanation: Luke 10:9 instructs the seventy to heal the sick and proclaim that the kingdom of God is near, emphasizing both physical and spiritual restoration.

questions.question: According to Luke 10:11-12, what lesson does Jesus teach about cities that reject the message of the seventy, and how does this compare to the judgment of Sodom?
options: It will be more tolerable for Sodom than for those cities on judgment day
They will be forgiven if they repent later
Sodom will be judged more harshly
They will be completely destroyed immediately
questions.correctAnswer: It will be more tolerable for Sodom than for those cities on judgment day
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that rejecting the gospel brings a worse judgment than Sodom, highlighting the gravity of rejecting God's message (Luke 10:12).

questions.question: Who are the three individuals mentioned in the Parable of the Good Samaritan in Luke 10:30-35?
options: A priest, a Levite, and a Samaritan
A Pharisee, a Sadducee, and a Samaritan
A priest, a Pharisee, and a Levite
A Levite, a soldier, and a Samaritan
questions.correctAnswer: A priest, a Levite, and a Samaritan
questions.explanation: The parable features a priest and a Levite who pass by the injured man, and a Samaritan who shows mercy, illustrating neighborly love transcending ethnic boundaries (Luke 10:30-35).

questions.question: In the parable, what actions did the Samaritan perform to help the man left half dead?
options: Bound his wounds, poured oil and wine, set him on his own beast, and paid for his care
Ignored him and passed by quickly
Called the authorities to help him
Prayed for him and left him on the road
questions.correctAnswer: Bound his wounds, poured oil and wine, set him on his own beast, and paid for his care
questions.explanation: The Samaritan cared for the injured man by binding wounds, using oil and wine as antiseptics, transporting him, and paying for his stay at an inn (Luke 10:34-35).

questions.question: What theological principle does Jesus emphasize in Luke 10:16 about those who hear or despise his disciples?
options: He who hears you hears me; he who rejects you rejects me, and him who sent me
Disciples are independent of Jesus
Only Jesus should be followed, not the disciples
Rejection of disciples has no consequence
questions.correctAnswer: He who hears you hears me; he who rejects you rejects me, and him who sent me
questions.explanation: Jesus affirms the authority of his disciples by linking acceptance or rejection of them to acceptance or rejection of Himself and God the Father (Luke 10:16).

questions.question: In Luke 10:18, Jesus says, 'I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven.' What is the significance of this imagery in light of Jewish apocalyptic literature?
options: It symbolizes Satan’s defeat and loss of heavenly status, paralleling Isaiah's fall of Lucifer
It foretells a natural disaster
It is a prophecy about a star falling
It indicates the coming of a new king
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes Satan’s defeat and loss of heavenly status, paralleling Isaiah's fall of Lucifer
questions.explanation: The imagery recalls Isaiah 14:12 and Ezekiel 28, symbolizing the defeat of Satan and his expulsion from heaven as a fallen angel.

questions.question: How does Luke 10:21 describe Jesus’ attitude toward revelation to the 'babes' as opposed to the 'wise and prudent'?
options: Jesus rejoices that God revealed truths to the humble rather than the proud
Jesus condemns the simple-minded
Jesus is indifferent to who receives revelation
Jesus praises the learned scholars
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus rejoices that God revealed truths to the humble rather than the proud
questions.explanation: Jesus thanks the Father for hiding truths from the wise and prudent and revealing them to childlike believers, emphasizing divine sovereignty in revelation (Luke 10:21).

questions.question: What is the relationship between Jesus and the Father as described in Luke 10:22 regarding mutual knowledge?
options: No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son
The Son is unknown to the Father
All people know the Father without the Son
The Son and Father are strangers to each other
questions.correctAnswer: No one knows the Son except the Father, and no one knows the Father except the Son
questions.explanation: Verse 22 highlights the unique, reciprocal knowledge between Father and Son, emphasizing their divine unity and exclusive revelation to chosen individuals.

questions.question: In Luke 10:25-28, a lawyer asks Jesus what must be done to inherit eternal life. What Old Testament command does Jesus direct him to, and what is its significance?
options: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, strength, and mind, and your neighbor as yourself
Follow all the dietary laws strictly
Offer sacrifices daily
Keep the Sabbath without fail
questions.correctAnswer: Love the Lord your God with all your heart, soul, strength, and mind, and your neighbor as yourself
questions.explanation: Jesus summarizes the Law with the greatest commandments from Deuteronomy 6:5 and Leviticus 19:18, emphasizing love as the foundation of eternal life.

questions.question: How does the story of Martha and Mary in Luke 10:38-42 illustrate the contrast between active service and contemplative listening?
options: Martha was busy serving while Mary sat at Jesus' feet to hear His word
Both sisters served equally
Mary was serving and Martha was resting
They both ignored Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Martha was busy serving while Mary sat at Jesus' feet to hear His word
questions.explanation: Martha’s distraction with service contrasts with Mary’s focus on learning from Jesus, illustrating the priority of spiritual nourishment over busyness (Luke 10:39-42).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He says to Martha, 'Mary hath chosen that good part, which shall not be taken away from her' in Luke 10:42?
options: Mary chose to prioritize listening to Jesus' teaching, which has eternal value
Mary selected the best food at the meal
Mary chose to leave the service unfinished
Mary decided to isolate herself from others
questions.correctAnswer: Mary chose to prioritize listening to Jesus' teaching, which has eternal value
questions.explanation: Jesus affirms that spiritual attentiveness and discipleship, exemplified by Mary, is the 'good part' with lasting significance (Luke 10:42).

questions.question: True or False: According to Luke 10:19, the seventy disciples were given power to trample on serpents, scorpions, and all the power of the enemy without being harmed.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Luke 10:19 states that Jesus gave power to the disciples to overcome evil forces symbolized by serpents and scorpions with no harm coming to them.

questions.question: In the cultural context of Luke 10, why would Jesus’ choice of a Samaritan as the compassionate neighbor in the parable be significant for His Jewish audience?
options: Samaritans were generally despised by Jews, so the parable challenges ethnic and religious prejudices
Samaritans were considered Jewish leaders
Samaritans were allies of the Jewish priests
Samaritans were wealthy benefactors of the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Samaritans were generally despised by Jews, so the parable challenges ethnic and religious prejudices
questions.explanation: The use of a Samaritan, viewed negatively by Jews, as the hero in the parable confronts social boundaries and redefines neighborly love (Luke 10:33).

theological.title: Luke Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Luke Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He sends the seventy 'as lambs among wolves'?
options: They will be vulnerable and face opposition
They will be powerful rulers
They will conquer cities by force
They will avoid all dangers
questions.correctAnswer: They will be vulnerable and face opposition
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the metaphor 'lambs among wolves' to indicate the vulnerability and hostility the seventy will face during their mission, as found in Luke 10:3. This aligns with the broader biblical theme of God's servants often facing persecution (Acts 7:26; Matthew 10:16; Psalm 23:4; Isaiah 53:7).

questions.question: According to Luke 10, what attitude should the seventy have regarding their provision during their mission?
options: They should not carry purse, scrip, or shoes
They should bring abundant supplies
They should buy food in every city
They should rely on their own resources
questions.correctAnswer: They should not carry purse, scrip, or shoes
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs the seventy to carry neither purse, scrip, nor shoes, indicating reliance on God's provision and hospitality of others (Luke 10:4). This reflects the principle of trusting God's care as seen also in Exodus 16:35; Deuteronomy 8:3; Matthew 6:25-34; Philippians 4:19.

questions.question: What is the significance of the greeting 'Peace be to this house' when entering a home?
options: It conveys a blessing and tests the receptiveness of the household
It is a formal salutation for hospitality
It requests permission to enter
It is a traditional Jewish custom
questions.correctAnswer: It conveys a blessing and tests the receptiveness of the household
questions.explanation: The greeting 'Peace be to this house' serves as both a blessing and a spiritual test of receptivity, with peace resting on the house if a 'son of peace' is present (Luke 10:5-6). This concept is consistent with biblical themes of peace as a sign of God's favor (Judges 6:24; Numbers 6:26; Ephesians 6:15; Romans 5:1).

questions.question: What instruction does Jesus give about moving from house to house during the mission?
options: Remain in the same house and do not move around
Visit multiple houses to spread the message
Only stay in the homes of religious leaders
Avoid staying overnight anywhere
questions.correctAnswer: Remain in the same house and do not move around
questions.explanation: Jesus commands the seventy to stay in the same house and not move from house to house, emphasizing stability and respect for the host (Luke 10:7). This teaching underscores principles of hospitality and focus found throughout Scripture (Genesis 18:4; Hebrews 13:2; 1 Timothy 5:10; Romans 12:13).

questions.question: How should the seventy respond if a city rejects their message?
options: Shake the dust off their feet and move on
Stay and try to persuade them
Pronounce a curse on the city
Ignore the rejection and remain silent
questions.correctAnswer: Shake the dust off their feet and move on
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs His disciples to shake the dust off their feet when a city rejects them, symbolizing a clear disassociation from unbelief (Luke 10:10-11). This act is consistent with Jewish customs and Jesus' teaching on judgment (Matthew 10:14; Acts 13:51; Deuteronomy 29:19; Ezekiel 33:8).

questions.question: What warning does Jesus give about the judgment of cities that reject the gospel?
options: It will be more tolerable for Sodom than for those cities
They will receive immediate forgiveness
They will be rewarded for their traditions
They will be forgotten in judgment
questions.correctAnswer: It will be more tolerable for Sodom than for those cities
questions.explanation: Jesus warns that judgment will be harsher for cities rejecting His message than for Sodom, a city symbolic of extreme sin and judgment (Luke 10:12). This reflects the principle of greater accountability with greater revelation (Matthew 11:20-24; Genesis 19:24; Jude 1:7; 2 Peter 2:6).

questions.question: What theological truth is expressed in Jesus' statement, 'He that heareth you heareth me; and he that despiseth you despiseth me'?
options: Unity between Christ and His sent disciples
Equality of all human teachers
Authority of the Pharisees
Independence of disciples from Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Unity between Christ and His sent disciples
questions.explanation: This statement underscores the inseparable unity and authority between Christ and those He sends to proclaim His message (Luke 10:16). It aligns with biblical doctrine of Christ's divine authority delegated to His apostles (John 13:20; Matthew 28:18-20; Hebrews 13:7; 2 Corinthians 5:20).

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by saying, 'I beheld Satan as lightning fall from heaven' to the seventy?
options: He witnessed Satan's defeat and loss of power
He saw Satan ascending to heaven
He saw Satan ruling over angels
He observed Satan creating the world
questions.correctAnswer: He witnessed Satan's defeat and loss of power
questions.explanation: Jesus' vision of Satan falling like lightning from heaven symbolizes Satan's defeat and diminished authority due to the ministry of the seventy (Luke 10:18). This aligns with Scripture describing Satan's fall and Christ's victory (Isaiah 14:12; Revelation 12:7-9; John 12:31; Colossians 2:15).

questions.question: What does Jesus emphasize as the true cause for joy for the seventy, beyond spiritual authority over demons?
options: That their names are written in heaven
That they have power over sickness
That they can perform miracles
That they are respected by people
questions.correctAnswer: That their names are written in heaven
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that the true reason for rejoicing is the assurance of salvation, signified by names written in heaven (Luke 10:20). This reflects biblical emphasis on eternal security and divine election (Philippians 4:4; Revelation 3:5; Romans 8:30; Hebrews 12:23).

questions.question: In Luke 10, how does Jesus describe the revelation of divine truths to His disciples?
options: Revealed to babes, hidden from the wise and prudent
Given only to the most educated
Shared with all equally
Concealed from everyone
questions.correctAnswer: Revealed to babes, hidden from the wise and prudent
questions.explanation: Jesus states that God has hidden mysteries from the wise and revealed them to babes, highlighting God's sovereign choice in revelation (Luke 10:21). This theme is consistent with Scripture emphasizing humility and childlike faith (1 Corinthians 1:27-29; Matthew 11:25-26; Isaiah 29:14; James 4:6).

questions.question: According to Jesus in Luke 10, who alone knows the identity of the Son and the Father?
options: The Father, the Son, and those to whom the Son reveals Him
All religious leaders
Only the angels
Every person who studies the law
questions.correctAnswer: The Father, the Son, and those to whom the Son reveals Him
questions.explanation: Jesus declares that the knowledge of the Father and the Son is exclusive to the Father, the Son Himself, and those whom the Son chooses to reveal Him (Luke 10:22). This statement reflects biblical teaching about divine revelation and the unique relationship within the Godhead (John 1:18; Colossians 2:9; Matthew 11:27; 1 Corinthians 2:10).

questions.question: What is the essence of the law according to the lawyer's answer in Luke 10?
options: Love God with all your heart and love your neighbor as yourself
Observe ceremonial rituals
Follow all dietary laws
Offer sacrifices regularly
questions.correctAnswer: Love God with all your heart and love your neighbor as yourself
questions.explanation: The lawyer summarizes the law as loving God wholly and loving one's neighbor, which Jesus affirms as correct (Luke 10:27-28). This encapsulates the Shema and Levitical commands (Deuteronomy 6:5; Leviticus 19:18; Matthew 22:37-40; Romans 13:9).

questions.question: In the parable of the Good Samaritan, who is identified as the true neighbor?
options: The one who showed mercy to the man attacked by thieves
The priest who passed by
The Levite who looked on and passed by
The man who was robbed
questions.correctAnswer: The one who showed mercy to the man attacked by thieves
questions.explanation: Jesus teaches that the true neighbor is the one who shows mercy and compassion, as illustrated by the Samaritan who cared for the wounded man (Luke 10:33-37). This teaching reflects God's call to mercy (Micah 6:8; Matthew 5:7; Proverbs 14:21; James 2:13).

questions.question: What contrast does Jesus draw between Martha and Mary in their response to His visit?
options: Mary chose to listen to Jesus while Martha was distracted by serving
Martha welcomed Jesus, Mary did not
Mary prepared food, Martha sat quietly
Both served Jesus equally
questions.correctAnswer: Mary chose to listen to Jesus while Martha was distracted by serving
questions.explanation: Jesus contrasts Mary’s attentive listening with Martha’s anxious serving, highlighting the priority of spiritual devotion over busyness (Luke 10:39-42). This reflects biblical emphasis on worship and contemplation of God’s word (Psalm 1:2; 1 Samuel 3:10; John 12:3; Hebrews 4:12).

questions.question: What core Christian doctrine is illustrated by Jesus' teaching that 'one thing is needful' and Mary has chosen it?
options: The primacy of relationship with Christ over works
The necessity of good works for salvation
The importance of religious rituals
The value of social service
questions.correctAnswer: The primacy of relationship with Christ over works
questions.explanation: Jesus emphasizes that spiritual relationship and listening to Him is the 'one thing' necessary, illustrating salvation by grace and faith rather than works (Luke 10:42). This doctrine is foundational in Scripture (Ephesians 2:8-9; John 15:5; Romans 3:28; Galatians 2:16).
